main event: An observer spotted an orange light with a blue haze, which appeared to be a rod-shaped object through binoculars, over Titusville, Florida in 1957.
interesting points: The object appeared to be the size of a dime at arm's length.
The observer saw multiple sightings of the object, with it appearing in different locations and numbers.
The object did not move while visible, but would disappear and reappear in a different location.
The observer used 7x50 binoculars to get a closer look at the object.
The object appeared to head towards the Vertical Assembly Building at the end of the final sighting.
sighted object: orange light with blue haze, rod-shaped object
photographs: yes, the report mentions 1 roll (16 frames) of original negatives provided for analysis
